info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 29 at 6:56PM EDT until August 29 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR OTTAWA AND SANDUSKY COUNTIES... At 654 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles north of Oak Harbor to 8 miles northeast of Fostoria, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Multiple large tree limbs were recently reported down in western Sandusky County. These storms have a history of producing widespread wind damage in northwestern Ohio. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Port Clinton, Kelleys Island, Put-In-Bay, Bellevue, Clyde, Oak Harbor, Gibsonburg, Woodville, Elmore, Green Springs, Ballville, Catawba Island, Marblehead, Bay View, Lindsey, Rocky Ridge, Helena, Burgoon and Stony Prairie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Ottawa and Sandusky Counties. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
